info.title: Creating a network bridge with a VXLAN

abstract.para: This topic describes how to create a network bridge with an attached VXLAN using &nm;.

topic.para: To make the communication with VXLAN more transparent, virtual machines (VMs) use a network bridge to which the VXLAN is attached. Run the following procedure on &productnameshort; hosts.

step.para: Create the network bridge br0 with no IPv4 and IPv6 addresses assigned.
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;nmcli connection add type bridge con-name br0 ifname br0 \ ipv4.method disabled ipv6.method disabled

tip.title: Custom destination port
tip.para: &nm; uses 8472 as the default destination port. To specify a different destination port, pass the option destination-port PORT_NUMBER to the command.

step.para: Create a VXLAN network interface attached to the bridge br0.
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;nmcli connection add type vxlan slave-type bridge con-name vxlan1-br0 \ ifname vxlan1 id 1 local 192.168.100.2 \ remote 202.0.115.1 master br0

callout.para: Specifies the source IP address for outgoing packets.
Specifies the unicast or multicast IP address for outgoing packets in case the destination link layer address is unknown in the VXLAN device forwarding database.
Creates this VXLAN connection as a port in the br0 connection.

step.para: If firewall is active, modify its rules to allow incoming UDP connections via port 8472.
